intro: Glochidion hayatae var. tsushimense, commonly known as the Tsushim Islands holly, is a shrub native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with a rough, leathery texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsules containing minute seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
